LIST OF APPENDICES
Product Appendix (“PA”)
Maintenance and Support Agreement (“MSA”)
Insurance Requirements
Template: Statement of Work (“SOW”)
Security Requirements
SOFTWARE AS A SERVICE “SAAS”
US Specific Provisions
Data Protection Appendix
This SOFTWARE LICENSE AGREEMENT FOR APPLICATIONS (“Agreement”) is made by and between:
Zebracorp inc., a corporation validly organized and existing under the laws of New York, USA, having its principal place of business at Golden Arch Avenue 99, Austin, TX 09910, USA, business identity code AB123456444, including its Affiliates (“Zebracorp”); and
APRECOT, a company incorporated under the laws of India with its principal office at jumanzi 2, Mumbai, 560078, India registration number AABB2020202 (the “Supplier”).
WHEREAS:
(A)	Zebracorp is a leading developer, manufacturer and Supplier of sophisticated industrial equipment, software and services for the application in industrial systems and terminals, accessories and connectivity solutions; and
(B)	The Supplier is a developer, owner, manufacturer, distributor and publisher of software products and a provider of related services; and
(C)	The Supplier and Zebracorp desire that the Supplier provides certain software products and services to Zebracorp and its customers, including Software as a Service (“SaaS”), as further described in and pursuant to the Software as a Service Appendix to this Agreement.
NOW THEREFORE IT IS HEREBY AGREED:

1.	DEFINITIONS
For the purposes of this Agreement, the capitalized terms below shall have the following meanings:
“Affiliate” of a Party shall mean an entity:
(i) 	which is directly or indirectly controlling such Party;
(ii) 	which is under the same direct or indirect ownership or control as such Party; or
(iii)	which is directly or indirectly owned or controlled by such Party.
For these purposes, an entity shall be treated as being controlled by another if that other entity has fifty percent (50 %) or more of votes in such entity, is able to direct its affairs and/or to control the composition of its board of directors or equivalent body.
“Agreement” shall mean this Software License Agreement for Applications including all Appendices and any other document specifically incorporated herein by reference.
“Appendix” or “Appendices” shall mean any documents which the Parties by mutual agreement attach to this Agreement. All Appendices shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
“Clause” shall mean any numbered paragraph or section of this Agreement.
“Confidential Information" or “Information” shall mean any information that a Party deems confidential, secret and/or proprietary that is disclosed by one Party (“Disclosing Party”) to the other Party (“Receiving Party”) under this Agreement that (a) is clearly marked as proprietary and/or confidential when disclosed; (b) if not marked as confidential or proprietary, the confidentiality and proprietary nature can be reasonably interfered under the circumstances and/or (c) is not marked but is announced as confidential and proprietary when disclosed and followed up in writing as to its confidential status. Confidential Information can be written, oral or visual.  Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the terms and conditions of this Agreement, including prices, are the Confidential Information of both Parties.
“Contractor” shall mean any Zebracorp subcontractor, supplier, licensor or other third party designated by Zebracorp with respect to Zebracorp Product(s) and the Licensed Product(s).
“Customer” shall mean any person, company, corporation or other entity, which obtains or intends to obtain any Licensed Products and/or services from Zebracorp or its Affiliates.
“Documentation” shall mean any and all technical documentation and other documents related to the Licensed Products and/or the Results of Services.
“Error” shall mean any mistake, problem, defect, malfunction or deficiency which causes an incorrect or inadequate functioning or non-functioning of any Licensed Products or any deviation from the Specifications, Documentation or other requirements set forth under this Agreement for a Licensed Products.
“Effective Date” shall mean the date, on which this Agreement becomes effective as agreed in this Agreement or in the absence of such agreed date upon the date of last signature of this Agreement.
“Force Majeure” shall mean the occurrence of an event or condition that is beyond a Party's reasonable control and which cannot reasonably be foreseen including natural disasters or catastrophic events such as epidemics, nuclear accidents, fire, flood, typhoons or earthquakes, acts or omissions by any government authorities, such as foreign currency restrictions, war, riots, sabotage or revolutions, and similar events.
“Intellectual Property Rights” shall mean patents (including utility models), design patents, designs (whether or not capable of registration), chip topography rights, and other like protection, copyright, trademark and any other form of statutory protection of any kind and any applications for any of the foregoing as well as any trade secrets and know how.
“Licensed Product” shall mean any and all software products including any software applications and components delivered under this Agreement including also the related Documentation as may be described in further detail in the Product Appendix and/or any Statement of Work, including any future modifications, Updates, Upgrades, bug fixes and Error corrections to any of the foregoing items.
“Legislative Requirements” shall mean i) all laws, regulations, acts, orders, by-laws, decrees, or other such ordinances of the jurisdiction where any Licensed Products are being manufactured, transported and delivered to and where any Services under this Agreement are being carried out, and ii) all requirements, permits, approvals, licences, certificates and other directives made by any other authorities, public bodies, or other organizations having jurisdiction in connection with the performance of this Agreement.
“Maintenance Services” shall mean the services described in Appendix “Maintenance and Support Agreement” of this Agreement.
“Zebracorp Payments” shall mean Zebracorp’s centralized system for payments pursuant to which all invoices maturing on or before the predetermined payment day (the “Payment Day”), are consolidated and paid on the Payment Day. The Payment Day is the first working day of the first week of each Zebracorp’s fiscal month, but the Payment Day may at any time and without prior notice be moved by Zebracorp to another day within that same week.
“Zebracorp Product” shall mean any hardware, software, software application or a combination thereof as well as any related material and documentation or any other item or solution commercialized, in any manner, by Zebracorp or for Zebracorp.
“Zebracorp Supplier Requirements” or “Zebracorp specs” shall mean the requirements Zebracorp has defined for its supply chain which are also used as a framework for audits and continuous supplier development/improvement as may be modified from time to time by Zebracorp during the term of the Agreement.  The Zebracorp specs can be provided in paper, electronic or other format upon Supplier’s written request.
“Object Code” shall mean computer programming code, substantially or entirely in binary form, which is directly executable by a computer after suitable processing but without the intervening steps of compilation or assembly.
“Open Source Software” shall mean (i) software provided under a free and/or open source license including, but not limited to, one approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI  http://www.opensource.org/) or (ii) proprietary software provided royalty-free, in binary code form, under an end user license agreement, which may be accepted without a signature, or (iii) shareware provided free of initial charge, such as on a trial basis, but where a fee may become due once the user decides to use the software beyond the trial period, or (iv) public domain software.
“Order“ shall mean a document (i) which bears the title or identification  “purchase order” or “order” on its face, (ii)  issued by Zebracorp in an electronic format using Zebracorp’s internal order system tools, (iii) which contains the unique purchase order number, and (iv) in which Zebracorp requests Supplier to provide specific Licensed Product(s) and/or Services under the terms and conditions of this Agreement and such Licensed Products and Services are itemized with corresponding price, ordered quantity and item identification (either by line item code or by item description). Order may include, as applicable, also payment milestones, specifications, acceptance criteria, time schedule and delivery arrangements.
“Party” or the “Parties” shall mean Zebracorp and/or the Supplier.
“Professional Services” shall mean any professional services (including without limitation consulting and integration services), and/or any other such services provided by Supplier pursuant to this Agreement as may be specified in further detail in the Statement of Work or a professional services agreement.
“Quality Requirements” shall mean the requirements that Zebracorp has defined in Clause XX (Quality to which all Products and Services shall strictly conform.
“Results of Services” shall mean all of the output and/or results of any Professional Services, including but not limited to technical documents, tooling, data, software (in both Source Code and Object Code) and/or any and all materials or documentation in whatever form arising out of or relating to the Professional Services, which are written, developed, generated or otherwise provided by the Supplier or by both Parties jointly pursuant to this Agreement (including the Statement of Work).
“Services” shall mean the Professional Services and the Maintenance Services.
“Source Code” shall mean such source code level system documentation, comments and procedural code, in human readable and in machine readable forms, of a software computer program which will enable Zebracorp to understand, recreate, compile, maintain, support, edit, debug, correct and modify such software computer program and which shall include without limitation source codes and source listings, descriptions and logics, job control language, compilation and installation control scripts, diagrams, interface definition files, password building procedures and security systems enabling to maintain as well as create new keys, and other data or materials relevant or relating to such software computer program.
“Specifications” shall mean any data and information related to the design, function, performance, reliability and quality of the Licensed Products as set forth in this Agreement and any modifications or amendments and new specifications thereto.
“SOW” or “Statement of Work” shall mean a Customer Project specific document as further described in Clause 3 of this Agreement.
“Updates” shall mean any Licensed Products and/or modification to any Licensed Product which primarily contains Error corrections and/or minor enhancements or improvements of the Licensed Products, but does not contain significant new features, including thereto applicable updated Documentation. The Updates are usually designated as a change in the version number to the right of the decimal point (from x.1 to x.2).
“Upgrade” shall mean any Licensed Products which primarily contains major enhancements and new features including thereto applicable updated Documentation. The Upgrades are usually designated as a change in the version number to the left (from 1.yz to 2.yz) of the decimal point.
Defined terms indicating the singular also include the plural and vice-versa, where the context so requires.
Other capitalized terms used in this Agreement or any of its Appendices shall have the meanings as defined in the respective clauses of this Agreement or any the Appendices.

2.	PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT
2.1	The purpose of this Agreement is to set out the terms and conditions under which Zebracorp may order Licensed Products, the SaaS and Services from the Supplier and under which the Supplier agrees to provide the same to Zebracorp.
2.2	The Affiliates of Zebracorp may order Licensed Products, the SaaS and/or Services and agree SOWs in their own name and for their own account under the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Zebracorp (and/or its Affiliates) may also order Licensed Products , the SaaS and/or Services and agree SOWs with the Affiliates of the Supplier.
2.3	For the avoidance of doubt, it is expressly stated that nothing contained in this Agreement or otherwise shall mean that Zebracorp has any obligation to agree SOWs, place any Orders, or to have any other purchase commitments for any Licensed Products, the SaaS or Services under or in relation to this Agreement.

3.	STATEMENTS OF WORK
3.1	Upon Zebracorp’s request the Parties shall agree upon a Statement of Work, a template of which has been attached to this Agreement as Appendix “Statement of Work (SoW)”. All Statements of Work shall reference this Agreement and shall form an integral part of this Agreement.
3.2	The Statement of Work shall define the Licensed Products, the SaaS and Professional Services to be provided by Supplier, obligations of both Parties, additional terms and conditions, if any, applicable and such other details as the Parties deem appropriate.
3.3	Subject to the execution of the Statement of Work both Parties agree to perform their respective obligations in accordance with the Statement of Work (and this Agreement).
3.4	Zebracorp may request a change in the terms of the Statement of Work.  The Parties undertake to negotiate and agree the effects of such change to scope and contents of the Statement of Work. For the avoidance of doubt, it is expressly stated that the Supplier shall not have the right to implement any changes without Zebracorp’s prior written consent. The Supplier agrees to implement and execute any reasonable requested changes for a reasonable price substantially in accordance with the pricing principles and levels agreed in the Statement of Work and this Agreement.  Notwithstanding the above, the changes shall be implemented by the Supplier without any additional charge, unless the Supplier is able to demonstrate, that the change causes additional costs for the Supplier.
3.5	Zebracorp may cancel a Statement of Work and/or any related Orders by giving the Supplier a seven (7) days’ written notice without any liability towards the Supplier with the exception of the payment of any Services performed up and until the termination date.

source_document.header: 4.	GRANT OF LICENSES AND OTHER RIGHTS
source_document.text:
4.	GRANT OF LICENSES AND OTHER RIGHTS
4.1	Licenses
Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Supplier hereby grants to Zebracorp under all Intellectual Property Rights necessary for such grant . the following non-transferable  (except as otherwise permitted under this Agreement), non-revocable (except for uncured material breach of the Agreement by Zebracorp), worldwide, non-exclusive licenses for the term of this Agreement (and as permitted after the term under Clause Term and Termination and as needed for maintenance and support):
4.1.1	Use and reproduction
to use the Licensed Products and to customize, make, have made and use copies of any Licensed Products and to install or otherwise bundled with, or incorporate Licensed Products and/or any copy thereof into any Zebracorp Products, and to localize in order to meet any local requirements and to adapt any Licensed Products to interoperate with any Zebracorp Product or Customer product by inter alia creating or having created software interfaces and/or other Zebracorp proprietary interfaces or scripts;
4.1.2	Distribution
to market, sell, distribute by any means and otherwise make Licensed Products available directly or indirectly through third parties and a license to grant perpetual and irrevocable sublicenses and rights to Customers to use Licensed Products, subject to Supplier’s right of revocation described above.
4.1.3	Marketing, Customer Care and Internal Use
a royalty-free license to use any Licensed Products for pre-sales, marketing, customer trial, demonstration, evaluation, customer training and customer care purposes and for internal testing and training purposes;
4.1.4	Virtualization, Managed Services and Hosting
a license to use or have used the Licensed Products, and to Customers the right to use or have used the Licensed Product, for the purpose of providing over the network and through remote access the features and functionality of the Licensed Product as a virtualized, managed and/or hosted service (including but not limited to software as a service) to Customers, affiliates, Customers own end-user customers or subscribers or other third parties through various service or delivery models, including but not limited to single-tenancy or multi-tenancy cloud computing, provided that all such use shall be subject to the terms of this Agreement.
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in any of the clauses of this Agreement, the licenses granted under this Clause 4.1.4 shall be transferable free of charge within Zebracorp Affiliates.
4.1.5	Source Code
whenever the source code of the Licensed Products is provided to Zebracorp,
Zebracorp shall have the right to use such source code solely for support, interoperability, and maintenance purposes. Any modification, reproduction, or creation of derivative works shall require prior written approval from the Supplier and shall be subject to a separate source code license agreement. ;
4.1.6	Software Development Tools
to use any software development or programming tools to understand, recreate, compile, maintain, edit, debug, correct and modify the Licensed Products and/or the Results of Services with the right to permit the Customer(s) to use the same.
4.1.7	Documentation
to use, reprint, translate, redesign or otherwise modify and/or have used, reprinted, translated, redesigned and/or otherwise modified the Documentation.
4.1.8	Contractors
Any licenses granted to Zebracorp under this Agreement shall include Affiliates of Zebracorp. Any licenses granted to Zebracorp under this Agreement shall also extend to the Contractors of Zebracorp but only to the extent required for the purpose of enabling such Contractors to perform work or provide services for Zebracorp and only while such Contractors are providing such services to Zebracorp.
4.1.9	Trademarks and Copyright Notices
For the avoidance of doubt it is expressly stated that Zebracorp may elect to use its own name and trademarks in combination with the marketing, selling and distribution of the Licensed Product and the pertaining documents and that Zebracorp shall have no obligation to reproduce any trademarks of the Supplier. Zebracorp shall, however, not have the right to remove or obscure any customary copyright notices from the Licensed Products.

source_document.header: 5.	DELIVERY OF LICENSED PRODUCTS AND PROFESSIONAL SERVICES
source_document.text:
5.	DELIVERY OF LICENSED PRODUCTS AND PROFESSIONAL SERVICES
5.1	Supplier shall deliver the Licensed Products in a timely manner and perform the Professional Services to the highest standard of skill, care, quality and diligence of a professional and in a timely and cost effective manner in accordance with and in full compliance with this Agreement, the respective Statement of Work and the Legislative Requirements. Supplier shall, as soon as the Supplier becomes or should become aware of any delay in meeting any mutually agreed time schedule, be obliged to inform Zebracorp thereof in writing stating the reason for the delay and the effect of the delay on the time schedule.
5.2	The Parties acknowledge and agree that downloading through internet is the preferred delivery method for the Licensed Product(s). In case this delivery method is not available and unless otherwise agreed, the Supplier shall deliver any Licensed Products in tangible media according to DDP VAT unpaid (INCOTERMS© 2020) to a place designated by Zebracorp within 5 (five) days from the date of the Order unless a later delivery date has been defined in the Order.
5.3	In the event that the Supplier fails to meet the agreed time schedule and/or any other milestones or such other fixed dates set forth in the SOW, then the Supplier shall be liable to pay Zebracorp liquidated damages in the amount of 0.5% per calendar day, capped at 10% of the affected Order value, and only applicable if the delay is not caused by force majeure or Zebracorp’s own actions..For the avoidance of doubt, it is expressly stated Zebracorp shall not be obligated to show evidence to the Supplier in respect of having suffered actual damage as a result of a delay in order to claim the liquidated damages. The payment of any of these amounts or parts thereof shall not discharge the Supplier of any of its obligations under this Agreement. The unconditional acceptance or receipt of any delayed Licensed Products and/or Results of Services shall not preclude Zebracorp from claiming any outstanding amounts specified above.

6.	ORDERING PROCEDURE
6.1	Zebracorp may place Orders for the Licensed Products and Services by e-mail, by fax or in electronic form or in any other mutually agreed manner. The Supplier may reject an Order within three (3) business days from the receipt of the Order, otherwise the Order shall be deemed accepted. Supplier may however reject any Order only to the extent the Order is not in conformance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Any Order rejection has to specify in detail the non-conformance of the Order in order to be valid. In case Zebracorp’s Order, the Supplier's confirmation of an Order or the Supplier's invoice contain terms and conditions, which are in conflict with this Agreement, such terms and conditions shall be regarded as null and void.
6.2	Supplier shall not commence with provision of the Licensed Products and Services prior to receiving corresponding Order. Zebracorp shall have no payment obligation for Licensed Products and Services provided without an Order.
6.3	Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained elsewhere in this Agreement, Zebracorp may cancel any Order issued hereunder within seven (7) days from the date of the Order without any liability towards Supplier with the exception of the payment of any Services performed up and until the termination date of the Order.

7.	INITIAL TESTING AND ACCEPTANCE
7.1	Testing by the Supplier
The Supplier shall test the Licensed Products for Errors and for compliance with the Specification(s), Statements of Work and the Quality Requirements prior to delivery. Upon request of Zebracorp, Supplier shall submit Zebracorp its inspection and testing records.
7.2	Testing by Zebracorp
Zebracorp may elect to test the Licensed Product(s) and/or the Results of the Services for compliance with the requirements of this Agreement as set forth in particular in the Specifications, Statement of Work(s), and the Quality Requirements. If the Licensed Products and/or the Results of Services do not meet the requirements of this Agreement within thirty (30) days from the first delivery of the same to Zebracorp, and Supplier has been given a chance to cure any default., Zebracorp has the right to terminate this Agreement or the relevant Statement of Work and/or any Orders wholly or partially without any liability towards Supplier.
7.3	Customer Acceptance
The Customer acceptance procedure, including the test process and the Customer acceptance criteria shall be set forth in the Customer Project specific Statement of Work. However, unless otherwise agreed in a Statement of Work, if the Licensed Products and/or the Results of Services fail to pass the Customer acceptance, the Supplier shall correct any and all Errors in the Licensed Products and/or in the Results of Services and deliver the respective corrected Licensed Products and/or the Results of Services without undue delay. If the Licensed Products and/or the Results of Services fail to pass the Customer acceptance following such new delivery, Zebracorp has the right to terminate the relevant Statement of Work and/or any Orders wholly or partially without any liability towards Supplier.

8.	DOCUMENTATION
8.1	The Supplier shall deliver the agreed number of the Documentation free of charge in an appropriate electronic format or as otherwise agreed between the Parties. The Supplier shall ensure that the Documentation will correspond to the latest technical state of the Licensed Products and the Results of Services, and the Supplier agrees to update such Documentation accordingly. Such updates shall identify any technical changes.
8.2	The Supplier shall provide the Documentation in English, unless agreed otherwise in writing.

9.	PAYMENTS
9.1	Any payments to be made for the Licensed Products, the Services and the rights and licenses granted hereunder are exclusively set out in the Products Appendix, and such payments shall be the sole and exclusive payments to be made by Zebracorp for the Licensed Product and the Services.
9.2	Unless agreed otherwise in the SOW and subject always to the provisions of this Agreement, the Supplier may invoice the license fees for the Licensed Products from Zebracorp after the customer acceptance and subject always to the receipt of a valid Order. Unless agreed otherwise in the SOW or the Maintenance and Support Agreement and subject always to the provisions of this Agreement, the Supplier may invoice any Services on a monthly basis subject always to the receipt of a valid Order for such Services from Zebracorp.
9.3	Each Supplier’s invoice shall contain information prescribed by the applicable statutory law provisions and following information: (i) the Order number specified in the relevant Order, (ii) the name of the Zebracorp requestor/contact person, (iii) payment term in accordance with the Agreement, (iv) description and the line-item split of Licensed Products and Services corresponding to the line-item split set forth in the Order, (v) bill-to and ship-to entity name, code and address set forth in the Order, (vi) correct tax codes and applicable jurisdiction (where applicable), (vii) Supplier’s relevant bank account identification. Unless otherwise instructed by Zebracorp or required by applicable local law regulations, Supplier shall submit the invoice in accordance with the terms of this Agreement and through Zebracorp’s electronic invoicing submission channels described in the Zebracorp P2P Supplier portal https://p2p.supplier.zebracorp.com/.  Supplier acknowledges that non-compliance with the foregoing content/process requirements may cause rejection of the non-compliant invoice by Zebracorp and/or delay in invoice handling / payment and in which case Zebracorp takes no liability for any delay in payment of such invoice.
9.4	To the extent not inconsistent with mandatory provisions of the applicable law Supplier’s invoices shall mature for payment within ninety (90) days of receipt of a correct and undisputed invoice or acceptance of Licensed Products/Services, whichever occurs later and shall be paid according to Zebracorp Payments.
9.5	If Zebracorp is overdue on any payment due under the Agreement and subject to Supplier’s written reminder of such, then the Supplier shall be entitled to claim interest on the overdue amount at an annual rate equal to one (1) percentage point above the Euro Interbank Offered Rate (EURIBOR) for Euro deposits offered for a one-month/one week period or a comparable period as shown at or about 11:00 a.m. (London time) by the applicable the European Securities and Market Authority (“ESMA”) Benchmark Administrator or by any successor for administration of the Euribor on the due date, which interest shall accrue on a monthly  basis from the date payment becomes overdue until the Supplier receives payment of the overdue amount.
9.6	All amounts payable are gross amounts but exclusive only of any value added tax, sales tax or their equivalent. If any such tax is or will be chargeable, Zebracorp shall pay the tax to the Supplier and the Supplier shall provide Zebracorp with a tax invoice that meets all conditions necessary to allow Zebracorp to reclaim such tax. If according to applicable law or regulations Zebracorp is liable for any such tax, Zebracorp will account for or pay the tax to the tax authorities. Each Party agrees to comply with all tax laws applicable to transactions contemplated under this Agreement and each Party is responsible for all taxes (including, but not limited to, taxes based upon its income) or levies imposed on it under applicable laws, regulations and tax treaties as a result of any contract and any payments hereunder. In the event that a withholding tax is payable, Zebracorp shall be entitled to deduct the withholding tax from the payment to the Supplier as required under applicable laws, regulations and tax treaties. Upon request of the Supplier, Zebracorp agrees to furnish evidence of such paid taxes to the Supplier as is sufficient to enable the Supplier to obtain any tax credits available to it.
9.7	If an Order under this Agreement is made by a US based Affiliate of Zebracorp, then notwithstanding the tax obligations as defined in Clause 9.6 above, for sales to US based Affiliate of Zebracorp, Supplier shall provide Zebracorp with a completed tax certification (e.g. Form W-9, applicable Form W-8 series form, or Form 8233, as appropriate) for federal income tax reporting purposes. In the event that the information provided on the submitted tax certification is or becomes incorrect, inaccurate or no longer valid, or if the tax certification expires, Supplier shall promptly notify Zebracorp no more than thirty (30) days from the date Supplier has actual knowledge or suspects such information must be modified and submit a new tax certification.  Failure to meet these requirements could result in a delay in payment.  Zebracorp shall have no liability to Supplier for late payments that result from Supplier’s failure to comply with this Clause.  Zebracorp shall have the right to audit Supplier’s compliance with this Clause.

10.	WARRANTIES
10.1	General
The Supplier represents and warrants that it has full rights and power to grant Zebracorp the rights set out in this Agreement.
10.2	Licensed Products
The Supplier warrants that the Licensed Products shall not contain any viruses or other malicious code. The Supplier further warrants that the Licensed Product shall for a period of 12 months from the date of customer acceptance (the “Warranty Period”) be free from Errors and strictly comply with the applicable Specifications and Quality Requirements and perform all functions described in the applicable Documentation.
If any Licensed Products fail to comply with the foregoing warranties, the Supplier shall at no cost to Zebracorp and without prejudice to any further rights of Zebracorp, without undue delay and no later than within the time periods agreed in Maintenance and Support Agreement, either deliver an Update, Upgrade or a complete new copy of the Licensed Product, which will not contain or which will remedy the Error or other deficiency. The Supplier warrants that new versions of Licensed Product(s) delivered to Zebracorp under this Agreement shall be compatible with the corresponding prior version(s) of such Licensed Product(s).
10.3	Results of Services
Unless otherwise agreed in the SOW, the Supplier warrants that any Results of Services shall for a period of 12 months from the date of customer acceptance (“Warranty Period”) be free from any Errors and fit for the purpose for which they are intended. The Supplier further warrants that any Results of Services provided to Zebracorp hereunder shall at all times comply with the Legislative Requirements and all other relevant requirements, specifications, standards and other criteria set forth in this Agreement (and the Statement of Work).
If any Results of Services fails to comply with any of the foregoing warranties, the Supplier shall at no cost to Zebracorp at Zebracorp’s option and without prejudice to any further rights of Zebracorp rectify or replace any part of the Results of Services to fully satisfy the given warranties at the Supplier’s sole risk and expense within a reasonable time period specified by Zebracorp.
10.4	Documentation
Supplier warrants that the Documentation provided to Zebracorp hereunder is and always shall be up to date and complete, technically correct and can be used for the purposes set forth in this Agreement and that Supplier is entitled to grant the rights under the Documentation in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. If Documentation supplied by Supplier hereunder fails to conform to the foregoing warranty, Supplier shall correct the Documentation without undue delay.

11.	OPEN SOURCE SOFTWARE
11.1	Supplier shall provide to Zebracorp, in electronic format designed by Zebracorp, a list of Open Source Software contained in the Products provided under this Agreement.  Such list shall contain, with respect to each Open Source Software and any dependent components contained as parts of such Open Source Software the following information:
the component names of each Open Source Software,
the version of each Open Source Software component,
the name and version of all Open Source Software licenses governing each Open Source Software component,
the license text or link to the license terms and
the usage and nature of the Open Source Software
11.2	Supplier shall promptly provide an updated list to indicate any changes or additions to the Open Source Software, such as but not limited to updates to version numbers and newly added Open Source Software.  Any such updated list shall be deemed part of this Agreement.  In addition, Supplier shall provide Zebracorp with full and complete copyright and license notices applicable to any part of the Open Source Software included into the Products, in an appropriate format such that Zebracorp can, in turn, furnish the same copyright and license notices when distributing the Products.  Supplier represents and warrants that (a) the list provided pursuant to this Clause is a full and complete list, and (b) Supplier is in full compliance with the applicable license or licenses for the Open Source Software contained in the Products.
11.3	Supplier shall license Open Source Software to Zebracorp under the same license grant terms as were applicable to the Open Source Software when obtained by Supplier.  Notwithstanding anything stated in such applicable Open Source Software license terms, Supplier is not relieved from Warranties, Intellectual Property Rights indemnification or any other obligations under this Agreement for the Products and any disclaimers contained in such applicable Open Source Software license terms shall not limit such Warranties, Intellectual Property Rights indemnification or other obligations under this Agreement.  Supplier represents and warrants that the Open Source Software undertakings in this Clause 13 will be and have been met and the distribution of Open Source Software in the Products is in full compliance with the applicable license terms for the Open Source Software.
11.4	Supplier represents and warrants that Open Source Software in the Products are not used in a manner which could cause Zebracorp product(s) or any other software linked or communicating with the Products to be subject to any requirements or obligations arising from the Open Source Software licenses.
11.5	Upon Zebracorp’s request, Supplier shall provide to Zebracorp, within five (5) business days of such request, all source code including any scripts needed for compilation and/or execution of the Open Source Software included into the Products, including all software that becomes subject to Open Source Software licensing terms through linking or communicating with any other software. Such source code will be provided to Zebracorp in electronic format.
11.6	Supplier represents and warrants that:
(a)	Open Source Software in the Products has been analyzed to ensure there are no incompatibilities between different Open Source Software licenses or between Open Source Software licenses and other licenses within the Product(s); and
(b)	Products include no Open Source Software licensed under General Public License version 3 or Lesser General Public License version 3 or Affero GPL v 3 or any derivatives thereof.
11.7	Supplier shall indemnify Zebracorp against all damages, losses, penalties, compensation and expenses caused by any failure by Supplier to comply with this Clause 11 and shall defend Zebracorp against all actions, claims, demands and proceedings arising out of such failure to comply.

12.	INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS
12.1	Ownership in Results of Services
All right, title and interest in and to all Intellectual Property Rights in or related to any Results of Services, shall vest in and become the sole and exclusive property of Zebracorp. If and to the extent it is impossible as a matter of law to transfer ownership in Intellectual Property Rights to Zebracorp, the Supplier hereby grants Zebracorp an exclusive, irrevocable, perpetual, transferable, fully paid-up, worldwide and unlimited right to use and exploit in any possible manner (including but not limited to the right to modify, copy, amend, translate, further develop, prepare derivative works of, distribute and sublicense) all Intellectual Property Rights pertaining to the Results of Services and warrants with respect to its representatives and any third party engaged to the performance of the Professional Services, that they will do the same.
12.2	Zebracorp acknowledges that the copyright and ownership in any Results of Services produced by the Supplier prior to and in no relation to the execution of the Professional Services shall remain vested with the Supplier. The Supplier hereby grants Zebracorp an exclusive, irrevocable (except for uncured material breaches of this Agreement by Zebracorp), perpetual, transferable, fully paid-up, worldwide and unlimited right to use and exploit in any possible manner (including but not limited the right to modify, copy, amend, translate, further develop, prepare derivative works of, distribute and sublicense) all Intellectual Property Rights pertaining to the such pre-existing copyrights if and to the extent such pre-existing copyrights are necessary for Zebracorp for the purpose of exploiting the Results of Services procured pursuant to this Agreement and the Supplier warrants with respect to its representatives and any third party engaged to the performance of the Professional Services on behalf of the Supplier under this Agreement, that they will do the same.
12.3	No Transfer of any Zebracorp Proprietary Rights
Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be deemed by implication or otherwise to transfer any Intellectual Property Rights of Zebracorp to the Supplier and Zebracorp shall continue to own all right, title and interest including, but not limited to, the Intellectual Property Rights in and to any Zebracorp Product. Zebracorp may adapt or have adapted the Licensed Products to operate in or in connection with Zebracorp Products or Customer products by inter alia creating or having created software interfaces and/or other Zebracorp proprietary interfaces or scripts and Zebracorp shall at all times own the Intellectual Property Rights in and to any such adaptations. To the extent and if not otherwise expressly agreed by the Parties, any customisation of any Customer product or Zebracorp Product is needed, all Intellectual Property Rights in and to such customisation shall be owned by Zebracorp. Ownership to any other customisation shall be agreed in the SOW on a case-by-case basis. If the SOW contains no provisions on ownership rights, the ownership of any such customisation shall at all times vest with Zebracorp.
In the event Zebracorp provides the Supplier with any designs or other specifications, the Supplier shall have a limited licence to use such designs and specifications only for the performance of its obligations towards Zebracorp under this Agreement and for no other purpose whatsoever.
12.4	Intellectual Property Rights Infringement and Indemnities
The Supplier represents and warrants that the Licensed Products, the SaaS, or the Results of Services do not infringe any Intellectual Property Right of any third party.
The Supplier shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Zebracorp (and its Affiliates) at its own expense against any liabilities, claims, actions, damages, costs and expenses (including but not limited to attorney's fees and costs) incurred by Zebracorp, its Affiliates or their respective Customers or Contractors as a result  of infringement or alleged infringement of any Intellectual Property Rights of any third parties by the Licensed Products, the SaaS, the Results of Services or the use of or sale of such Licensed Products, the SaaS and/or Results of Services and/or  breach of Clause 11 (Open Source Software). Zebracorp shall (1) notify the Supplier of the allegation in writing and (2) upon Suppliers confirmation to defend, provide Supplier with the sole authority to defend such claim, provided that (a) Zebracorp shall have the right to have access to all necessary information to defend itself against the allegation as well as the right to select its own counsel to participate in any actions at the expense of Zebracorp (b) Supplier at all times takes into account the business interests of Zebracorp, its Affiliates and Customers in defending and settling such claim, and (c) Supplier shall obtain the prior written approval of Zebracorp, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, before entering into any settlement of such claim or ceasing to defend against such claim. Subject to Zebracorp defending the claim as set out above, Zebracorp shall cooperate with the Supplier, at the expense of the Supplier, in the defensive actions, as reasonably requested by the Supplier. Provided, however, that if the infringement relates to Results of Service, Supplier is only required to indemnify Zebracorp if the alleged infringement is related to Supplier’s work on the Results of Service.
12.5	Notwithstanding the Supplier's primary right to have control over defense, Zebracorp may take all necessary steps, at the expense of the Supplier, to defend itself until the Supplier, to the reasonable satisfaction of Zebracorp, assigns a counsel and initiates defense in a professional manner.
12.6	In addition to what is set forth above in Clause 12.5, if Zebracorp's continued use of the Licensed Product, the SaaS and/or the Results of Services is restricted or threatened to be restricted as a result of any such claim, demand, suit or action alleging infringement, the Supplier shall (without limiting its indemnity obligation above) at its expense and at Zebracorp's request either (1) modify the Licensed Product, the SaaS and/or the Results of Services to avoid the allegation of infringement, while at the same time maintaining compliance of the Licensed Products, the SaaS and/or the Results of Services with the Specifications and other requirements of this Agreement, or (2) obtain for Zebracorp at no cost to Zebracorp a license to continue using and exploiting the Licensed Products, the SaaS and/or the Results of Services in accordance with this Agreement free of any liability or restriction.
12.7	It is expressly agreed and understood that any claim under this Clause shall not become time-barred earlier than the corresponding third party claims giving reason to such claim.

13.	PRODUCT LIABILITY
13.1	The Supplier shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Zebracorp (including its Affiliates) against claims, liabilities, actions, damages costs and expenses (including but not limited to attorney’s fees) incurred by Zebracorp, its Affiliates or their respective Customers or Contractors as a result of personal injury, death, or property damage attributable to the Licensed Products, the SaaS or any the Supplier’s acts or omissions of the Supplier. The Supplier shall not be liable for damages under this Clause Product Liability to the extent arising from the use of the Licensed Products or the SaaS outside the Documentation .

14.	QUALITY ASSURANCE; SECURITY REQUIREMENTS
14.1	Supplier shall have, and shall ensure that its sub-suppliers have, a management policy and quality management system (“QMS”) conforming to the latest requirements of ISO9001. The QMS shall ensure effective planning, management and control of performance and quality throughout the life cycle of products or services being provided hereunder.
14.2	Zebracorp Supplier Requirements ("Zebracorp specs") is a set of requirements that Zebracorp sets for its supply chain. Zebracorp uses these requirements as a framework for audits and continuous supplier development and Supplier expressly confirms that it has received a copy of the Zebracorp specs.
14.3	Supplier shall use reasonable efforts to maintain its processes and practices consistent with the requirement defined in the Zebracorp specs to the extent applicable to Supplier under this Agreement.
14.4	Supplier shall establish and maintain business continuity management practices that comply with the requirements of the latest version of ISO22301.
14.5	Supplier shall have a systematic approach to protect itself and Zebracorp from disruptions in its business with Zebracorp. Supplier shall have plans and arrangements covering critical business operations and processes to ensure continuity of Supplier’s performance under the Agreement. Supplier undertakes to periodically test such plans. Zebracorp reserves the right to review Suppliers’ plans, mock test drill reports and the related documentation.
14.6	Supplier shall have a supplier base strategy and supplier base management for its sub-suppliers under this Agreement, based on short- and long-term business needs. Supplier shall manage its sub-suppliers according to a documented procedure and the requirements under this Agreement.
Supplier shall continuously monitor the performance of its sub-suppliers using key performance indicators (e.g. product quality indexes, project metrics, assessment results, ratings, process reviews).
14.7	Supplier warrants that in the designing, developing, delivering and through the entire supply chain, all applicable national and international laws, directives, statutes (including but not limited to EU statutes) and regulations are diligently followed.
14.8	Upon Zebracorp’s request, Supplier agrees to implement a set of Key Performance Indicators (“KPIs”) to measure quality and delivery performance against targets, mutually defined by both Parties.  The request may be triggered by Zebracorp in case of repeating quality or delivery performance issues impacting Zebracorp’s schedule or end customers.
14.9	AUDIT
14.9.1	Zebracorp, its Customers and their respective Contractors shall have the right, at its cost, following reasonable notice to Supplier and during normal business hours, to audit (at Supplier’s and/or Supplier sub-suppliers’ premises) and inspect the deliverables, facilities and quality control as well as other processes of Supplier in the performance of this Agreement, in order to determine the level of Supplier’s compliance with the Zebracorp specs and other standard industry practices and standards, where applicable, such as ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 (“Audit”).
Supplier shall grant Zebracorp access to:
Supplier’s premises (as applicable, Supplier sub-supplier’s premises) and shall make qualified personnel available for the duration of the Audit; and
records pertinent to the audit, such as but not limited to, process documentation and defect logs, and project management risks logs
14.9.2	Each Audit will be documented by the Zebracorp Audit team in a report with Audit findings such as action items for improvements, non-conformances and collaboration.  Supplier agrees to initiate corrective actions to address the delayed action items, at a timeline agreed by both Parties, but not later than ninety (90) days from the date of the Audit report.  Zebracorp shall have the right to share the results of such Audit with its Customers.  Zebracorp, its Customers or their respective Contractors performing or otherwise becoming aware of any results of such Audit shall enter into confidentiality agreements providing adequate protection of any Confidential Information of Supplier disclosed during such Audit.  Supplier shall have a risk management policy and processes, defining how Supplier manages various types of risks such as, but not limited to, business risks, security, health and safety risks, fire.  The risk management processes shall promote proactive identification, analysis, control and monitoring of all types of risks.
14.10	FAILURE ANALYSIS
14.10.1	Supplier shall make a failure analysis for non-conforming Products and Services.
14.10.2	Where Supplier discovers a quality problem in Supplier’s Products or Services which may have influence on reliability, safety, form, fit, and function of the Product, Supplier shall inform Zebracorp thereof in writing without delay.
14.10.3	Upon Zebracorp’s request, Supplier shall perform Root Cause Analysis/
Escaped Defect Analysis (“RCA/EDA”) for any of the non-conforming Products and Services.  Zebracorp requires such analysis to be performed by the applicable subject matter expert (“SME”).  Supplier shall complete the RCA/EDA and share the result, including corrective and preventive action plan, with the Zebracorp representative within ten (10) calendar days unless agreed otherwise.  Zebracorp reserves the right to share the RCA/EDA result/report with its Customers.
14.10.4	Upon Zebracorp’s reasonable request, Supplier shall use Zebracorp’s tool to record, monitor and follow up on issues and problem status in Supplier’s performance of a RCA/EDA.  Zebracorp is responsible for providing users access to the tool for the Supplier.
14.11	RECORDS
14.11.1	Supplier shall keep product related records, including, but not limited to (i) product drawings and specifications (ii) requirement and design change histories (iii) product verification, qualification, validation, and release data (iv) minutes of the reviews/inspections and related data (v) test setup and data (vi) versioning data (vii) incoming material verification data (viii) product and production process setups verification data (ix) process capability report (x) rework performed (xi) process, materials and product failure analysis reports and (xii) production process data as applicable.
14.11.2	Supplier shall archive final testing pass records in a format that such records can be delivered without delay on Zebracorp’s request e.g. in order to forward such records to Zebracorp’s customer.
14.11.3	Supplier shall allow Zebracorp to inspect the records.
14.11.4	Supplier shall provide copies of such records on Zebracorp’s request.
14.11.5	Supplier shall retain final testing pass records for a period of ten (10) years from the final test or any legally required record retention period, whichever is longer.
14.12	The Supplier warrants that it shall at all times strictly comply with the IT-security related requirements set out in Appendix “Security Requirements”. Upon Zebracorp’s request, the Supplier shall enter into negotiation on the establishment of further processes to ensure and/or enhance the IT-security of the Licensed Products and/or the participation of Supplier to programs relevant to such IT-security.

15.	COMPLIANCE AND ETHICS
For the purposes of the following Clauses, the term "Supplier" shall include Supplier, its employees, officers, subcontractors, sub-suppliers or other representatives.
15.1	Each Party shall comply fully with all applicable laws, including international, national, regional and local laws, statutes, directives (EU or otherwise), decrees, orders, treaties and regulations. For the avoidance of doubt, compliance with this sub-section includes, but is not limited to, compliance with the United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and any other applicable legislation enacted to enforce or implement any international convention prohibiting bribery and corruption and anti-money laundering laws and regulations. Additionally, Supplier acknowledges that it has read and understands  the Responsible Business Alliance Code of Conduct as updated from time to time (“RBA Code of Conduct”) (available at http://www.responsiblebusiness.org/standards/code-ofconduct/) and undertakes to apply the standards set out in the RBA Code of Conduct as well as the Zebracorp 3rd Party Code of Conduct with respect to the performance of this Agreement.  Supplier acknowledges that Zebracorp has made available Zebracorp-specific sustainability requirements in addition to the RBA Code of Conduct as part of its Supplier Requirements, including access to online training relating to Zebracorp 3rd Party Code of Conduct.
15.2	Neither Party shall, directly or indirectly, offer, authorize, solicit, accept or give to any person, company or undertaking whatsoever, including any government official or employee (including Zebracorp employees) anything of value, including by not limited to any gift, entertainment or hospitality, which is intended or could be viewed to improperly influence the other Party’s employee or representative or to obtain or retain any business for or from Zebracorp or to gain any advantage in the conduct of business for Zebracorp.
15.3	Supplier agrees to keep accurate and complete records relating to the provision of Products and Services under this Agreement, including records relating to obtaining any government issued permits or authorizations and related correspondence, and to retain all such records for 10 (ten) years following the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement or for any legally required record retention period, whichever is longer.
15.4	Supplier furthermore undertakes to report any perceived or actual conflict of interest it becomes aware of, both on Zebracorp’s and on Supplier’s side.  Supplier also agrees to report any non-routine contact by a government regulatory or law enforcement agency investigating or questioning Supplier’s conduct relating to the performance of this Agreement. Suppliers should in such cases contact Zebracorp Ethics & Compliance at ethics@zebracorp.com or https://zebracorpethics.alertline.com.
15.5	Failure by the Supplier to comply with the provisions of this Clause 15 shall be deemed to be a material breach of this Agreement by Supplier entitling Zebracorp to terminate this Agreement without any liability to Zebracorp.
15.6	Supplier agrees to permit Zebracorp or its authorized representatives to audit Supplier’s compliance with these clauses.  Supplier shall fully cooperate in any Zebracorp investigation or audit regarding its compliance with this Clause 15.
15.7	Supplier shall indemnify and hold Zebracorp, Zebracorp Affiliates, Customers, employees, officers, directors, shareholders, subcontractors or other representatives harmless from and against any claims, losses, damages, liabilities and costs arising out of, related to, or connected with Supplier’s or Supplier’s subcontractors’ failure to comply with any of the obligations set forth in this Agreement.
15.8	In addition to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the terms and conditions set out in Appendix “US Specific Provisions” shall apply to any purchases made by Zebracorp Affiliates located in the United States of America or, as applicable, to the extent any purchases made under this Agreement are made for the benefit of Zebracorp’s US based customers.

16.	MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT
16.1	The Supplier shall provide Maintenance Services as set forth in this Clause and Appendix “Maintenance and Support Agreement (MSA)”.
16.2	The Supplier warrants that ´the Maintenance Services, including but not limited to Error correction of Licensed Products and software support in general shall be available to Zebracorp (and its Affiliates) subject to and in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth in Appendix “Maintenance and Support Agreement” for a period of ten (10) consecutive years from the last delivery of a Licensed Product under this Agreement

17.	CONFIDENTIALITY
17.1	Each Party ("Receiving Party") shall not disclose to third parties nor use for any purpose other than for the proper fulfilment of this Agreement any technical or commercial information ("Information") received from the other Party ("Disclosing Party") in whatever form under or in connection with this Agreement without the prior written permission of the Disclosing Party except information which:
(a)	is in the public domain at the time of disclosure or later becomes part of the public domain through no fault of the Receiving Party; or
(b)	was known to the Receiving Party prior to disclosure by the Disclos¬ing Party as proven by the written records of the Receiving Party; or
(c)	is disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party who did not obtain such Information, directly or indirectly, from the Disclosing Party;
(d)	or was independently developed (by personnel having no access to the Information) by the Receiving Party.
17.2	Any disclosure of Information to any third party under Clause 17.1 above shall further be subject to that third party having a need to know such Information for the Purpose and subject to that third party being prior to the disclosure of Information bound by written confidentiality undertakings no less stringent than the obligations imposed under this Agreement.
17.3	The Supplier hereby expressly agrees, that the use of Zebracorp as reference, and/or the use of Zebracorp or reference to Zebracorp in the marketing or in any materials or activities of the Supplier in any manner is strictly forbidden. The Supplier shall not make any statements, announcements and/or press release of this Agreement or part thereof, or of the relationship of the Parties, without the express prior written consent of Zebracorp.
17.4	The provisions of this Clause shall be valid for ten(10) years from the date of disclosure. Any Non-Disclosure Agreement(s) entered into between the Parties prior to the Effective Date of this Agreement shall remain to be valid, in accordance with its terms and conditions, in respect of the Information disclosed by either Party before the Effective Date of this Agreement, and in respect of the Information disclosed outside the scope of this Agreement.

18.	TERM AND TERMINATION
18.1	This Agreement shall become effective as of July 1st, 2025 and shall remain in force for an initial period of five (5) years from the Effective Date, unless terminated earlier as provided herein. This Agreement shall thereafter be automatically renewed for successive periods of one (1) year unless terminated by either Party with nine (9) months' written notice prior to such automatic renewal or the end of the initial period.
18.2	This Agreement, the Statements of Work and/or any Orders may by written notice of a Party to the other Party be terminated for cause if and when the other Party:
i) 	voluntarily files a petition in bankruptcy or has such a petition involuntarily filed against it or is subject to an insolvency proceeding or a proceeding giving protection against creditors, or if an order is issued appointing a receiver or trustee or a levy or attachment is made against a substantial portion of its assets which order shall not be vacated, or set aside within thirty (30) days from date of issuance, or if any assignment for the benefit of its creditors is made;
ii) 	.is in material breach of this Agreement and fails to remedy such breach within thirty (30) days after receipt of a written notice by the other Party specifying the nature of such breach and requiring remedy of the same.

19.	EFFECT OF TERMINATION
After the termination or expiration of this Agreement, Zebracorp may continue to use the Licensed Products and the SaaS in accordance with terms and conditions of this Agreement for a period of twenty four (24) months following the effective date of termination for the purpose of fulfilling any outstanding or incomplete orders, agreements and commitments which Zebracorp has entered into prior to the termination date of this Agreement (including for the purpose of fulfilling provision of access to the SaaS for the entire committed SaaS Subscription term with respect to each Customer) . “To the extent Zebracorp continues to use the Licensed Products and the SaaS we will be paid in accordance with this Agreement.”
19.1	For the avoidance of doubt, it is expressly stated that any termination or expiration of this Agreement (or any Statement of Work) shall not affect any rights of the Customers granted to them in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement during the validity hereof. For the avoidance of doubt, it is further expressly stated that any distribution rights and other rights and licenses granted by the Supplier to Zebracorp under this Agreement shall be extended for the time period required to complete the activities of Zebracorp contemplated in this Clause.
19.2	Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, any termination or expiry of this Agreement for whatever reason shall not affect the right of Zebracorp to provide support to such Customer.
19.3	Upon termination, Supplier shall delete or return personal data within 60 days, unless retention is required by law or for legitimate business records. Supplier shall certify deletion upon request.

source_document.header: 20.	FORCE MAJEURE AND DUTY TO INFORM
source_document.text:
20.	FORCE MAJEURE AND DUTY TO INFORM
20.1	Neither Party shall be held responsible for the non-performance of any obligations and duties under this Agreement, and/or any Order to the extent that such non-performance results from a Force Majeure event. If a Party claims that a Force Majeure event has occurred affecting its performance, it shall promptly notify the other Party.
20.2	If the Force Majeure continues for a cumulative period of sixty (60) days or more, Zebracorp may terminate this Agreement and/or any Order which are not yet fully performed with immediate effect by giving Supplier written notice. Termination shall be effective upon receipt of the notice without incurring any liability or charges.
20.3	Supplier agrees to promptly inform Zebracorp in writing of event(s) that are about to occur or appear imminent and may reasonably affect Supplier's ability to meet any of its obligations under this Agreement and/or under an Order, including without limitation, a potential delay in Delivery, a material change in ownership of Supplier, infringement of third party Intellectual Property Rights, or any other action, omission or development which would be important for Zebracorp to be aware of in order to take precautions to prevent such from causing adverse effect to Zebracorp’s  business, reputation, production schedule, or product liability.

21.	EXPORT CONTROL AND CUSTOMS REQUIREMENTS
21.1	Products and Services provided under this Agreement may be subject to customs and export control regulations, including but not limited to the export control regulations of the European Union (EU), and/or the US. Such export control regulations apply to hardware, software, technology and know-how. The Parties shall comply with all import and export laws applicable to each Party's import, export, re-export or use of the Products and Services.
21.2	The Supplier agrees that it shall provide Zebracorp the following data and information on the products: (i) US Export Control Classification Number (ECCN), if subject to the US Export Administration Regulations (EAR), (ii) EU ECCN, if listed in the Wassenaar List of Dual-Use Goods and Technologies, (iii) method of classification (self-classified or classified by the U.S. Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS)), (iv) CCATS number and CCATS document issued by the BIS (if available), (v) the French “Autorisation d’Exportation de Moyen de Cryptologie” (if available), (vi) Schedule B and HS code and (vii) country of origin ((i) through (vii) hereinafter collectively referred to as the “ECC Data”). Supplier agrees to provide the aforementioned ECC Data to Zebracorp for every Product without undue delay after Effective Date and at any time thereafter upon Zebracorp’s request. Supplier agrees to provide Zebracorp with all information reasonably required to obtain any license or other authorization under the applicable customs and export control regulations. Supplier further agrees to inform Zebracorp of any change in the ECC Data provided to Supplier or a change to the applicability of US export control regulations on the Products as soon as practicable after the change is known to Supplier.
21.3	For Products which are qualified for preferential treatment, Supplier shall provide with the delivery of such Products, on Zebracorp’s request, a valid declaration of preferential origin or certificate of preferential origin in compliance with applicable preferential arrangement/agreement.
21.4	Supplier shall provide Zebracorp or on Zebracorp’s request to a third party designated by Zebracorp, all information and documents required in global trade for global delivery and customs clearance, reselling and re-exportation. Supplier shall provide all information required to clearly identify and map the Products and related certificates or declarations of origin.
21.5	For Products delivered to Zebracorp in or into the European Union, Supplier shall provide, on Zebracorp’s request, a long-term declaration of non-preferential origin in compliance with article 60 of European Union Customs Code (UCC). For all Products which do not originate in the European Union, Supplier’s long-term declaration shall be endorsed by Supplier’s competent local chamber of commerce. Supplier shall provide Zebracorp a renewed long-term declaration of non-preferential origin as soon as origin of any included Product changes.
21.6	On Zebracorp’s request, Supplier shall provide with the deliveries of the Products certificates of origin in compliance with applicable international standards and regulations and endorsed by Supplier’s competent chamber of commerce.
21.7	Supplier shall provide the country of origin of each delivered physical product to Zebracorp on the invoice and on shipment accompanying documents. Official English country name or ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code must be used.
21.8	Supplier warrants that any data and other information provided to Zebracorp under this Clause are in all respects complete and correct. Supplier shall be liable for wrong certificate of origin or wrong declaration of preferential or non-preferential origin and shall hold Zebracorp harmless for all financial consequences including but not limited to customs duties.
21.9	Supplier shall provide complete and correct shipping documentation, which comprehends an invoice and a packing list, containing following attributes to comply with customs requirements:
21.10	Invoice number and date, Zebracorp Order reference, Supplier's complete name, address, phone number, e-mail address and VAT number (EORI number if available), Consignee complete name, address, (importer of records), dispatch/export country (export from), delivery terms (e.g. FCA named place, (INCOTERMS© 2020), payment terms, net and gross weight, quantity of boxes/crates, Zebracorp item number, material quantity and unit, comprehensive item description, country of origin, prices and currency, tariff/commodity code, ECCN classification.

22.	LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND INSURANCE
22.1	With the exception of claims relating to Intellectual Property Rights indemnification under Clause 12, product liability under Clause 13, and/or breach of confidentiality under Clause 17 , neither Party shall be liable to the other Party for loss of business or goodwill, loss of revenue or loss of profits or any indirect, special, punitive or consequential damage incurred by the other Party under or in connection with this Agreement.
The foregoing provision shall not be construed to limit or exclude any of the Supplier’s obligations arising from specific remedies provided under this Agreement, specifically, without limitation, any obligation regarding repair or replacement or any other such non-monetary remedies.
Supplier shall procure and maintain the insurance coverage specified in the Insurance Requirements Appendix.

23.	SUBCONTRACTORS
23.1	The Supplier agrees not to use a third party in the provision of the Services without Zebracorp's prior written consent. The Supplier has the sole responsibility and liability for the performance and non-performance of its third party sub-Supplier(s) and the use of sub-Supplier(s) shall not limit or abate any obligations of the Supplier under this Agreement irrespective of whether the sub-Suppliers have been recommended by Zebracorp.

24.	DATA PROTECTION
24.1	Supplier represents and warrants that it will comply with all applicable laws relating to data protection, privacy, export or data security enforced by a governmental authority, and such requirements shall apply to the transfer and processing of any personal data pursuant to this Agreement.
24.2	Supplier further represents and warrants that it will adopt, maintain and enforce appropriate security policies as well as data protection and safeguarding arrangements for the lawful protection of its personal data, communications and systems, and Supplier shall file for necessary registrations in relevant countries, where applicable. Supplier shall not access, process, transfer or use in any way, directly or indirectly, any personal data (meaning personal data as defined in Regulation (EU) 2016/679 as well as other customer and end-user personal data) under or in connection with this Agreement, neither during the Term hereof or thereafter except as necessary to perform its obligations hereunder.
24.3	The foregoing shall not be construed to limit or diminish any other obligations the Supplier may have elsewhere under this Agreement.
24.4	Where, under this Agreement, Supplier provides Services to Zebracorp or Customers, and Supplier’s access to personal data, in providing these Services, cannot be definitely excluded or is within the scope of the Agreement, the Parties shall execute and attach a Data Protection Appendix (“DPA”) to this Agreement, and Supplier shall process such personal data solely in accordance with the DPA, this Agreement and Zebracorp’s instructions. Notwithstanding the aforementioned, if, during the Term of this Agreement, Supplier or Zebracorp become aware that such access to personal data can no longer be definitely excluded, the Parties shall discuss such requirements and amend the Agreement by executing and attaching a DPA without undue delay.
APPENDICES

PRODUCT APPENDIX
This appendix is attached to and forms a part of the [contract name] (contract number: […]) (the “Agreement”). Unless otherwise noted, the capitalized terms used herein shall have the meaning ascribed to them in the Agreement.
1.	PRODUCTS AND PRICES
XXX-X-PR, VCS Premium - Annual (SAAS), Subscription based/Per Subscriber/Per Year $ 0.99
XXX Premium - Perpetual (SAAS), Perpetual License Per Subscriber, $ 19.99
XXX Premium - Annual (On Premises), Subscription based/Per Subscriber/Per Year, $ 0.99
XXX Premium - Perpetual (On Premises), Perpetual License Per Subscriber, $ 22.99
XXX Server On Premises Set Up/Training/Node Mapping, $ 10,000.00
XXX Server On Premises Annual Support, Support fee per subscriber per year, $ 3.99
• All prices are quoted in USD.
• Prices do not include Cloud/On-Prem infrastructure costs. Customer (Zebracorp) is responsible for arranging the necessary infrastructure to deploy solution.
• Billing is based on the total number of active subscribers at the time of invoicing.
• Each service is billed independently based on its respective active subscriber count on an agreed methodology.
• Subscriber count adjustments will be reflected in subsequent billing cycles.
• The first six (6) months of the subscription are provided free of charge
• SUPPLIER will provide all necessary APIs and technical support for integration with the customer’s OSS/BSS systems.
2.	PRODUCTS AND SPECIFICATIONS
XXX 1 (SUPPLIER platform)
SUPPLIER will support the customer with all existing and new CE compliant devices, mapping data model parameters to the XXX1 platform at no cost. The customer must provide access to such devices for testing during the integration process.
XXX 2 (SAAS ACCESS)
SUPPLIER will provide all necessary agent integrations for the customer’s network at no cost to either the customer or the OEMs. However, the customer is responsible for coordinating support from the OEMs to grant SUPPLIER access to their SDKs and toolchains to facilitate integration.
4.	ROADMAPPING
The product roadmaps as described in the Agreement for the products under this appendix are attached hereto in Exhibit 3, if applicable.

Quality appendix - to be removed
To be removed

MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT AGREEMENT
This appendix is attached to and forms a part of the Agreement (contract number: […]) (the “Agreement”). Unless otherwise noted or evident from the context, the capitalized terms used herein shall have the meaning ascribed to them in the Agreement.
LIST OF ANNEXES:
Annex SWSU	Software Services (Software Maintenance, Security Alert, Update & Upgrade Service)
Annex TrE	Training/Enabling
Annex PPT	Pricing and Payment Terms
Annex PoC	Points of Contact
The Annexes to this MSA shall form integral parts of this MSA. The Annexes to this MSA may be revised / renewed from time to time upon prior agreement between the Parties.
This MSA and its Annexes shall take precedence over the terms and conditions of the Agreement with regard to the subject matter described herein to the extent there is a conflict between the Agreement and this MSA. In case there is a conflict between the Annexes and this MSA, the Annexes will prevail with regard to the subject matter described thereof to the extent there is a conflict between the MSA and the Annex.
1.	DEFINITIONS
As used in this MSA, the capitalized terms set forth in this section 1 shall have the meanings set forth below.
“Business Day” shall mean each working day from Monday through Friday during Office Hours and excluding national/public holidays, in the country where Services are to be performed.
“Compatibility Matrix” or “CM” shall mean a matrix to highlight compatibility between differing versions of Software of the Licensed Products (“Products”).
"Error” shall mean any mistake, problem, defect, malfunction, Non-Conformance or deficiency which causes an incorrect or inadequate functioning or non-functioning of any Product or any deviation from the Specifications, Documentation or other requirements set forth under this Agreement for a Product or a risk of reliability, safety or Software security and/or a failure of a Product to operate in and/or in connection with Zebracorp Product and Zebracorp solution.
“Office Hour” shall mean Supplier’s Business Day hours from 8am to 6pm.
“On Site Service” shall mean services provided by Supplier upon Zebracorp’s request according to Annex OSS.
“Response Time” shall mean the time between Zebracorp’s notification in accordance with the mutual agreed interface description of an Error/Technical Query to the Supplier and the receipt of Supplier’s Initial Response, Workaround or Final Solution as defined in the Annex SWSU, as applicable.
“Service(s)” shall mean all those service(s) to be provided by Supplier under this MSA as more specifically defined in the Annexes hereto.
“Service-Order” shall mean a purchase order issued by Zebracorp for Services in accordance with the terms of this MSA.
“Site” shall mean each physical location in the country where the Product(s) have been installed or being used by Customer.
Further terms may be defined in the Annexes hereto or the Agreement.

2.	PROVISION OF SERVICES
During the term of this MSA, Supplier shall provide to Zebracorp Services agreed herein based on a Service-Order or as part of Supplier’s warranty obligations for Products as stipulated in Clause xx of the Agreement.

3.	CHANGES
Upon the written request of Zebracorp at any time during the term of this MSA, Zebracorp and Supplier shall meet and negotiate in good faith to agree upon changes within the general scope of this MSA.

4.	SERVICE-ORDERS
Zebracorp may purchase Services by issuing Service-Orders to the Supplier. However, Zebracorp’s execution of this MSA does not oblige Zebracorp to purchase any Services or issue any Service-Orders hereunder. Upon receipt of a Service-Order, the Supplier shall supply Services in accordance with the terms and conditions of this MSA and its Annexes.
The Supplier shall confirm the receipt of the Service-Order within two (2) Business Days after receipt of the Service-Order. The Supplier shall have the right to reject the Service-Order only in case the Service-Order is not in accordance with the terms and conditions of this MSA. All Orders will be deemed accepted, without written confirmation, by the Supplier unless Zebracorp has received a rejection from the Supplier within the above mentioned two (2) Business Days period.
The Supplier shall notify Zebracorp in writing and reasonably (not less than 3 months) in advance about any relevant Service-Order which is subject to annual renewal in accordance with Annex PPT (Pricing and Payment Terms). Supplier shall send detailed information with agreed references of the Services to be renewed in electronic form for Zebracorp review.
5.	INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK

6.	PRICES / INVOICING / PAYMENT
The prices for the Services under this MSA are stated in Annex PPT hereto or in the Product Appendix of the Agreement. In the event the prices for the Services are stated in the Product Appendix and not in the Annex PPT, all references to Annex PPT in this MSA shall be read as references to such Product Appendix.
Such prices shall be subject to the payment terms and other conditions set forth in the Agreement, unless otherwise stated in Annex PPT hereto.
Invoices shall be sent to the address stated in the Service-Order. If no address is stated, a notification requesting such information will be sent by Supplier to the responsible Zebracorp contact person as defined in Annex PoC to this MSA.

7.	INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND INDEMNIFICATION
For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties hereby agree that Intellectual Property Rights in and to the Updates, Upgrades and other Services shall be subject to the Intellectual Property Rights and Indemnification terms and conditions set forth in the Agreement.

8.	CONSEQUENCES OF DELAY
Notwithstanding the regulations in Clause xx of the Agreement, the respective stipulations in Annexes SWSU shall apply for delay in the provision of Services.

9.	WARRANTY FOR SERVICES
The Supplier warrants that the Services are available to Zebracorp on the terms and conditions of this MSA and for the time period set forth in the Agreement or in the respective Annex(es) hereto, whichever time period is longer.
The Supplier warrants that it will perform Services under this MSA in a professional manner by and through competent and qualified personnel familiar with the Product and its operation, and the Services shall equal or exceed the standards generally observed in the industry for similar services.
